comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content: There's still a St Patrick's in Greymouth, but a contemporary building, opened in 1994. This record on the NZETC site tells me that the foundation stone for St Patrick's Roman Catholic Church was laid in April 1887 and the church opened on 30 May 1888. The building was on Church Street - I'd love a street number so I can add it to our map. -- Courtney
comment.authorname: National Library NZ on The Commons

comment.author: 79955794@N04
comment._content:
It was on Chapel St Greymouth. Last time I was there both the church and where the priests lived was a back packers.. Cheers Brian   
After some further investigation, it looks like the present Chapel St was Church St in the early days,,,Cheers Brian
